OOG.content: three heights of historicity in Husserl: 1) general sense, essence of human existence moves in spiritual space of culture or tradition 2) European culture, theoretical project, philosophy 3) “conversion of philosophy into phenomenology”
OOG.linkedContent: three heights of historicity in Husserl: 1) general sense, essence of human existence moves in spiritual space of culture or tradition 2) European culture, theoretical project, philosophy 3) “conversion of philosophy into phenomenology”

OOG.content: for Husserl, subjectivity “normed” in the Present, “fastened” to a “higher subjectivity,” higher sense investigation
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, subjectivity “normed” in the Present, “fastened” to a “higher subjectivity,” higher sense investigation

R.content: event (im-possible) announces itself in the form of an injunction (comes from on high)
R.linkedContent: event (im-possible) announces itself in the form of an injunction (comes from on high)

MC.content: the alterity of the other is the very high
MC.linkedContent: the alterity of the other is the very high

MC.content: via Lucretius, infinite does not have height
MC.linkedContent: via Lucretius, infinite does not have height

SPOM.content: Kant placed his unconditional dignity (Würdigkeit) higher than any economy
SPOM.linkedContent: Kant placed his unconditional dignity (Würdigkeit) higher than any economy

SPOM.content: the great specter of classical tradition (Rome) is convoked (positive conjuration) to allow one to rise to height of historic tragedy
SPOM.linkedContent: the great specter of classical tradition (Rome) is convoked (positive conjuration) to allow one to rise to height of historic tragedy

POO.content: a higher responsibility, a more intractable (intraitable) moral exigency, uneven as it may be, [Nietzsche’s Aussermoralischen Sinn]; p. 133n “pure morality” go beyond duty, beyond duty as debt, duty w/out debt, a silent break w/culture and language
POO.linkedContent: a higher responsibility, a more intractable (intraitable) moral exigency, uneven as it may be, [Nietzsche’s Aussermoralischen Sinn]; p. 133n “pure morality” go beyond duty, beyond duty as debt, duty w/out debt, a silent break w/culture and language

POOF.content: Aristotle’s primary friendship: the highest rank (stable, requires act of faith)
POOF.linkedContent: Aristotle’s primary friendship: the highest rank (stable, requires act of faith)

POOF.content: via Aristotle, one must choose & prefer friends (election & selection), it takes time > for Aristotle, those who don’t have friends count friends among things (prágmata), possessions, the malevolent place friends in field of calculable hypothesis > yet, the choice of friends, that their # must be small, reintroduces #, calculation, into multiplicity of incalculable singularities: a certain aristocracy in arithmetic of the choice
POOF.linkedContent: via Aristotle, one must choose & prefer friends (election & selection), it takes time > for Aristotle, those who don’t have friends count friends among things (prágmata), possessions, the malevolent place friends in field of calculable hypothesis > yet, the choice of friends, that their # must be small, reintroduces #, calculation, into multiplicity of incalculable singularities: a certain aristocracy in arithmetic of the choice

POOF.content: Derrida reads Nietzsche [re: GS 61] as advocating acceptance of gift & dependency,  elevating logic of gift above self-sufficiency of a subject [Greek philosopher who refuses King’s donation], a logic that reorients friendship, calling friendship back to irreducibility of other—but perhaps this installs an irresponsible freedom, madness (friend–enemy), the worst?
POOF.linkedContent: Derrida reads Nietzsche [re: GS 61] as advocating acceptance of gift & dependency, elevating logic of gift above self-sufficiency of a subject [Greek philosopher who refuses King’s donation], a logic that reorients friendship, calling friendship back to irreducibility of other—but perhaps this installs an irresponsible freedom, madness (friend–enemy), the worst?

POOF.content: Nietzsche envisions 2 people craving a new desire & lust for possession, a shared higher thirst for an ideal above them: that would be named friendship
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche envisions 2 people craving a new desire & lust for possession, a shared higher thirst for an ideal above them: that would be named friendship

POOF.content: Derrida advises spouses who love each other to read Michelet’s Le Peuple [?] in bed at night: husband hesitating to betray justice, wife urging him to save the enemy, sacrifice for her, make her feel young again > Michelet: “woman is always higher or lower than justice”
POOF.linkedContent: Derrida advises spouses who love each other to read Michelet’s Le Peuple [?] in bed at night: husband hesitating to betray justice, wife urging him to save the enemy, sacrifice for her, make her feel young again > Michelet: “woman is always higher or lower than justice”

POOF.content: fraternal friendship & ascension, height: Kant’s stellar sublimity of moral law, Nietzsche’s star friendship
POOF.linkedContent: fraternal friendship & ascension, height: Kant’s stellar sublimity of moral law, Nietzsche’s star friendship

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s hermit too attracted to the depths, nostalgic for elevation—dreams of a friend to gain altitude > friend’s nostalgia: wish to believe in other, wishing in vain to believe in ourselves > Derrida links this nostalgia to the Heideggerian nostalgia at origin of philosophical philía: elle nourrit [fires?] donc l’envie à l’égard de l’autre comme de nous-mêmes, we envy each other, love as the attempt to leap beyond this envy
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s hermit too attracted to the depths, nostalgic for elevation—dreams of a friend to gain altitude > friend’s nostalgia: wish to believe in other, wishing in vain to believe in ourselves > Derrida links this nostalgia to the Heideggerian nostalgia at origin of philosophical philía: elle nourrit [fires?] donc l’envie à l’égard de l’autre comme de nous-mêmes, we envy each other, love as the attempt to leap beyond this envy

POOF.content: Nietzsche: higher still than love of man is love of causes and of specters (Sachen und Gespenstern)
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche: higher still than love of man is love of causes and of specters (Sachen und Gespenstern)

BL.content: the height of the human, 2 legs, is what creates repression; turning away is an upward movement, purification, turns away from that which stinks: the history of the law
BL.linkedContent: the height of the human, 2 legs, is what creates repression; turning away is an upward movement, purification, turns away from that which stinks: the history of the law

HASD.content: for Heidegger, gathering of Geviert takes place in an indivisible topos, simplicity of point [of sword]: “the place (Ort) gathers toward itself at the greatest height and extremity”
HASD.linkedContent: for Heidegger, gathering of Geviert takes place in an indivisible topos, simplicity of point [of sword]: “the place (Ort) gathers toward itself at the greatest height and extremity”

HASD.content: Eckhart’s “new adjunct writings” [highest adjunct, adjunct to God]

EM.content: Heidegger: humanism does not realize the proper dignity of man, does not set humanitas high enough
EM.linkedContent: Heidegger: humanism does not realize the proper dignity of man, does not set humanitas high enough

EM.content: is Nietzsche the last metaphysician as Heidegger reads him? or is Heidegger the last sleeping shudder (le dernier sursaut ensommeillé) of the higher man?
EM.linkedContent: is Nietzsche the last metaphysician as Heidegger reads him? or is Heidegger the last sleeping shudder (le dernier sursaut ensommeillé) of the higher man?

VM.content: no matter how high, height is always accessible, most high is higher than height, does not belong to space, to this world
VM.linkedContent: no matter how high, height is always accessible, most high is higher than height, does not belong to space, to this world

VM.content: face is most high because it is origin of space [Feuerbach on height, substance, face] [engenders set outside of set]
VM.linkedContent: face is most high because it is origin of space [Feuerbach on height, substance, face] [engenders set outside of set]

VM.content: acc. Levinas, reciprocity of Buber’s I-thou does violence to height
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, reciprocity of Buber’s I-thou does violence to height

PAS.content: Blanchot: “at the highest point of contradiction, I was this illegitimate dead person”
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: “at the highest point of contradiction, I was this illegitimate dead person”

PAS.content: Blanchot: solemn and noble procession toward what goal? and then forgetfulness came
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: solemn and noble procession toward what goal? and then forgetfulness came

S.content: [re: Heidegger’s Rectorship Address] le profond et l’altier (haughty) allied in most high: highest of what guides the spiritual guides of die hohe Schule and depths of forces of earth and blood
S.linkedContent: [re: Heidegger’s Rectorship Address] le profond et l’altier (haughty) allied in most high: highest of what guides the spiritual guides of die hohe Schule and depths of forces of earth and blood

S.content: Schelling: spirit is breath of love, but love is the Most High [i.e. higher than spirit]
S.linkedContent: Schelling: spirit is breath of love, but love is the Most High [i.e. higher than spirit]

PPHS.content: the sign, “the height conserving in its depths the hegemony of the soul,” is the pyramid [later, Derrida will live through this tomb not, like Hegel, by negating it]
PPHS.linkedContent: the sign, “the height conserving in its depths the hegemony of the soul,” is the pyramid [later, Derrida will live through this tomb not, like Hegel, by negating it]

FWT.content: event falls upon me vertically from so high (not most high)—does not come upon me horizontally, also event surprises from behind, or I never see it, I feel or hear it/him (barely)
FWT.linkedContent: event falls upon me vertically from so high (not most high)—does not come upon me horizontally, also event surprises from behind, or I never see it, I feel or hear it/him (barely)

DS.content: title—capital: carries its head too high, raises its voice, drowns out ensuing text
DS.linkedContent: title—capital: carries its head too high, raises its voice, drowns out ensuing text

P.content: Kant: moral pleases universally & positively, “morally good in the idea of highest finality—benevolence, purity, strength, equanimity”
P.linkedContent: Kant: moral pleases universally & positively, “morally good in the idea of highest finality—benevolence, purity, strength, equanimity”

P.content: sublime (Erhaben), superelevation (what in Glas is called the élève), absolutely high, not measurable in height
P.linkedContent: sublime (Erhaben), superelevation (what in Glas is called the élève), absolutely high, not measurable in height

P.content: acc. Kant, sublime is absolutely large, w/out dimension, an unequal equal only to itself > why is there still reference to a cise in space? if absolutely large why not absolutely small? Kant’s preference of largeness is tautological: more is more (preference itself thinks more)
P.linkedContent: acc. Kant, sublime is absolutely large, w/out dimension, an unequal equal only to itself > why is there still reference to a cise in space? if absolutely large why not absolutely small? Kant’s preference of largeness is tautological: more is more (preference itself thinks more)

P.content: why is “quantum” for sublime, which is unmeasurable, always considered large? this logic must be similar to St. Anselm’s
P.linkedContent: why is “quantum” for sublime, which is unmeasurable, always considered large? this logic must be similar to St. Anselm’s

P.content: double trait of cise, limits and unlimits at the same time, divided line upon which colossus comes to cise itself—and incises itself w/out cise > the sublime
P.linkedContent: double trait of cise, limits and unlimits at the same time, divided line upon which colossus comes to cise itself—and incises itself w/out cise > the sublime

P.content: Kant calls this “subjective,” this psychic ideality, “not in nature,” the psyche as kolossos, superelevated, beyond height
P.linkedContent: Kant calls this “subjective,” this psychic ideality, “not in nature,” the psyche as kolossos, superelevated, beyond height

SP.content: Nietzsche: we wanderers see our heights as places of safety
SP.linkedContent: Nietzsche: we wanderers see our heights as places of safety

SP.content: Nietzsche: in Sermon on the Mount, things not looked at from a height
SP.linkedContent: Nietzsche: in Sermon on the Mount, things not looked at from a height

ATIA.content: Derrida will produce a key not to free animals, but to rethink their proper, will offer high notes to change the stave (portée) (also a flat, to tone it down, change the tune)
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida will produce a key not to free animals, but to rethink their proper, will offer high notes to change the stave (portée) (also a flat, to tone it down, change the tune)

ATIA.content: for Kant, the power to have the “I” is the erection of man, infinitely above: the subject
ATIA.linkedContent: for Kant, the power to have the “I” is the erection of man, infinitely above: the subject

FS.content: Derrida shows how structuralism can rely on dimension of height, where values mount scalewise & Good is most high, to think quality (inner intensity) w/ out giving up on structure
FS.linkedContent: Derrida shows how structuralism can rely on dimension of height, where values mount scalewise & Good is most high, to think quality (inner intensity) w/ out giving up on structure

DIF.content: forgetting of ontological difference: disappearance of trace of trace > Heidegger: even the early trace (die frühe Spur) is obliterated when presence is in the position of the highest
DIF.linkedContent: forgetting of ontological difference: disappearance of trace of trace > Heidegger: even the early trace (die frühe Spur) is obliterated when presence is in the position of the highest

DPi.content: [in Genet] Christlike ascension/elevation after the gallows, quasi-ressurection
DPi.linkedContent: [in Genet] Christlike ascension/elevation after the gallows, quasi-ressurection

DPi.content: from Kant to Blanchot > no law w/out DP, homo noumenon above homo phaenomenon > one must raise oneself by means of law above life & inscribe from this height DP in law
DPi.linkedContent: from Kant to Blanchot > no law w/out DP, homo noumenon above homo phaenomenon > one must raise oneself by means of law above life & inscribe from this height DP in law

DPi.content: DP speaks in 3rd person present (can’t say: “I am no more”), copula signifies instantaneous passage from being to nothingness (“he is no more”): stigmē, Most High, Last Judgment, God’s verdict (always instant of death of a 3rd party, never me, you, us)
DPi.linkedContent: DP speaks in 3rd person present (can’t say: “I am no more”), copula signifies instantaneous passage from being to nothingness (“he is no more”): stigmē, Most High, Last Judgment, God’s verdict (always instant of death of a 3rd party, never me, you, us)

Gi.content: will not be a question of heights, thinking difference not up to it [in contrast to Nietzsche?]
Gi.linkedContent: will not be a question of heights, thinking difference not up to it [in contrast to Nietzsche?]

Gi.content: for Heidegger, sexual difference did not rise to height of ontological difference? > ontic predicate
Gi.linkedContent: for Heidegger, sexual difference did not rise to height of ontological difference? > ontic predicate

Gi.content: Heidegger, by going back “further,” higher > avoids religion, ethical, even dialectical schemas
Gi.linkedContent: Heidegger, by going back “further,” higher > avoids religion, ethical, even dialectical schemas

REST.content: point does not bring foot in contact w/ a surface, doesn’t spread out on a surface (the soles, the ground)—surface is lower than the foot, goes lowest (Derrida’s never examined this)
REST.linkedContent: point does not bring foot in contact w/ a surface, doesn’t spread out on a surface (the soles, the ground)—surface is lower than the foot, goes lowest (Derrida’s never examined this)

REST.content: Derrida on Freud’s shoe fetish: shoe replaces that which is lacking not because of its form but because of its directional situation > syntax of a movement upwards from the very-low, most-low
REST.linkedContent: Derrida on Freud’s shoe fetish: shoe replaces that which is lacking not because of its form but because of its directional situation > syntax of a movement upwards from the very-low, most-low

REST.content: the other one [the other lowness], always the supplement of lowness (le bas) [re: political insults in Heidegger/Shapiro’s correspondence]
REST.linkedContent: the other one [the other lowness], always the supplement of lowness (le bas) [re: political insults in Heidegger/Shapiro’s correspondence]

REST.content: lowly shoes levitate, il élève jusqu’à la figure, transfigured shoes (haloes of themselves) look up toward most high: the Face [by way of restitution]
REST.linkedContent: lowly shoes levitate, il élève jusqu’à la figure, transfigured shoes (haloes of themselves) look up toward most high: the Face [by way of restitution]

D.content: invisible column—undecidable, unmasterable in its height, uncontrollable in extension > unique & innumerable like what is called (the) present
D.linkedContent: invisible column—undecidable, unmasterable in its height, uncontrollable in extension > unique & innumerable like what is called (the) present

HST.content: complacent height: nothing more haughty (hautain) than “I forgive you”
HST.linkedContent: complacent height: nothing more haughty (hautain) than “I forgive you”

HST.content: must welcome the infinite (for Levinas, that’s 1st hospitality), forgive beyond me, what is not mine to forgive [forgiving in my name but only in the name of the other]: must think substitution from limit-experiences (decision, gift, forgiveness), from possible-impossible, the impossible of the possible
HST.linkedContent: must welcome the infinite (for Levinas, that’s 1st hospitality), forgive beyond me, what is not mine to forgive [forgiving in my name but only in the name of the other]: must think substitution from limit-experiences (decision, gift, forgiveness), from possible-impossible, the impossible of the possible

HST.content: substitution of hostage as un être-sous, être-dessous, not the beneath of subjectum, substantia, hypokeimenon but submitted (soumis), assujetti, to the height of the Most High (law above)
HST.linkedContent: substitution of hostage as un être-sous, être-dessous, not the beneath of subjectum, substantia, hypokeimenon but submitted (soumis), assujetti, to the height of the Most High (law above)

HST.content: love, mystical love, gives itself w/out giving anything but itself > abandons itself while asking forgiveness at the height of the other
HST.linkedContent: love, mystical love, gives itself w/out giving anything but itself > abandons itself while asking forgiveness at the height of the other

+R.content: into (over) the bargain (the market) (par-dessus le marché), not au-dessus (above) the market (the lure in which you would again let yourself be caught) > puts in play, or en abyme, the destructive simulacra of surplus value
+R.linkedContent: into (over) the bargain (the market) (par-dessus le marché), not au-dessus (above) the market (the lure in which you would again let yourself be caught) > puts in play, or en abyme, the destructive simulacra of surplus value

C.content: w/out-example ejects the paradigm > still exhibits it in some way: raises it up (surélève) on rostrum of its catafalque, ex cathedra (in the pulpit it stays silent)
C.linkedContent: w/out-example ejects the paradigm > still exhibits it in some way: raises it up (surélève) on rostrum of its catafalque, ex cathedra (in the pulpit it stays silent)

TN.content: knowledge of soul, acc. Aristotle, of the highest rank
TN.linkedContent: knowledge of soul, acc. Aristotle, of the highest rank

TN.content: for Nancy, sublime: imagination feeling its powerlessness as it touches the limit (limit conceived as height, absolute height)
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, sublime: imagination feeling its powerlessness as it touches the limit (limit conceived as height, absolute height)

AD.content: aphoristic energy of déliasion in Levinas’ ethical affirmation: from subordination (no interiorization), to welcome of Most High (host), to unicity of possibility of substitution (hostage)
AD.linkedContent: aphoristic energy of déliasion in Levinas’ ethical affirmation: from subordination (no interiorization), to welcome of Most High (host), to unicity of possibility of substitution (hostage)

AD.content: Levinas gives teaching magisterial height: teaching what “to welcome,” “to receive”
AD.linkedContent: Levinas gives teaching magisterial height: teaching what “to welcome,” “to receive”

CIN.content: [on the structure of the text CIN, tension btwn writing and speech] “vibration of grammar in the voice” destined for the eye, or the interior voice, absolutely low voice
CIN.linkedContent: [on the structure of the text CIN, tension btwn writing and speech] “vibration of grammar in the voice” destined for the eye, or the interior voice, absolutely low voice

BSi.content: sovereign, highest, most eminent capital or capitalization, monopolizes force/violence—Gewalt—gives reason in advance to force through right
BSi.linkedContent: sovereign, highest, most eminent capital or capitalization, monopolizes force/violence—Gewalt—gives reason in advance to force through right

BSi.content: erected marionettes, Sovereign in its Majesty, Most High—not merely a trope, [it’s sublimity is even practical]: surveillance (economic/military) strategy
BSi.linkedContent: erected marionettes, Sovereign in its Majesty, Most High—not merely a trope, [it’s sublimity is even practical]: surveillance (economic/military) strategy

BSi.content: “excellently eminent and excellently phallic erection of sovereign highness”
BSi.linkedContent: “excellently eminent and excellently phallic erection of sovereign highness”

BSi.content: snake, beast, low; albatross, sovereign, high
17th century sovereign referred to as “Your Altitude”

Nietzsche’s superman, and the sovereign too, a hyperbolic, sublime, “higher than height,” more about excess than height, it’s the more than that counts, the surplus, absolutely more: could as well be a maximum of smallness, God as small (sovereign use of nanotechnology)
BSi.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s superman, and the sovereign too, a hyperbolic, sublime, “higher than height,” more about excess than height, it’s the more than that counts, the surplus, absolutely more: could as well be a maximum of smallness, God as small (sovereign use of nanotechnology)

ATAP.content: “Come” doesn’t try to lead, can always be appropriated: “I am in the act of seducing you” can always increase seduction > “Come” can always lead back higher than itself toward conductive violence, toward authoritarian “duction”
ATAP.linkedContent: “Come” doesn’t try to lead, can always be appropriated: “I am in the act of seducing you” can always increase seduction > “Come” can always lead back higher than itself toward conductive violence, toward authoritarian “duction”

CIR.content: “I am for an aristocracy w/out distinction, therefore w/out vulgarity, for a democracy of the compulsion to the highest price, you have to pay the price to read the price displayed”
CIR.linkedContent: “I am for an aristocracy w/out distinction, therefore w/out vulgarity, for a democracy of the compulsion to the highest price, you have to pay the price to read the price displayed”

EU.content: for Kant, the “higher” faculties are Theology, Law, Medicine (because closer to government power)  > philosophy is lower, though his ideal enacts a reversal
EU.linkedContent: for Kant, the “higher” faculties are Theology, Law, Medicine (because closer to government power) > philosophy is lower, though his ideal enacts a reversal

EU.content: ontological-encyclopedic hegemony/structure, univerticality, tends to immobilize all recognized borders > all-powerful & powerless (destiny of philosophy subjected to State power)
EU.linkedContent: ontological-encyclopedic hegemony/structure, univerticality, tends to immobilize all recognized borders > all-powerful & powerless (destiny of philosophy subjected to State power)

EU.content: CIPH will outline different topology: horizontal, transversal, heterogenous > experiment
EU.linkedContent: CIPH will outline different topology: horizontal, transversal, heterogenous > experiment

EU.content: [re: CIPH] against pyramidal hierarchy [height?], for horizontality

FV.content: depth is height, flows out (débouche) toward the high, precisely the mouth (bouche) in which is “incarnated” the Nous, Logos, phallic signifier > reason is reason itself, aura raison, logic of kettle (a check [traite] drawn from reason): there is only one libido, it is masculine in nature
FV.linkedContent: depth is height, flows out (débouche) toward the high, precisely the mouth (bouche) in which is “incarnated” the Nous, Logos, phallic signifier > reason is reason itself, aura raison, logic of kettle (a check [traite] drawn from reason): there is only one libido, it is masculine in nature

FV.content: one reason, male libido, altus, at the bottom of things—highest truth
FV.linkedContent: one reason, male libido, altus, at the bottom of things—highest truth
